result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Z McCaleb was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert Z McCaleb is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert Z McCaleb was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to Milwaukee County case 08CF5569.  No credit given.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment, life skills, education, employment, mental health, and CGIP.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Spend 1 year in the county jail.  Agent has the authority to stay any balance of conditional jail upon placement in a treatment program they feel is appropriate.  May not have contact with drug users or dealers, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Supervision in mental health unit.  Maintain complete sobriety.

timeConds.notes: Agent has the authority to stay any balance of conditional jail upon placement in a treatment program they feel is appropriate.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Z McCaleb

records.addlTxt: Revoked - Sentenced to Prison

Deft called stating that he called his agent, Charles Sosinski, and informed him of his current addresss and was told there was no one else he could report to. Notified Agt Sosinski of this by e-mail.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in custody. Clerk/H. Barnett. Court advises deft it is up to the agent whether or not to put him into a treatment program; refers deft to sign up for the Living Free Program.

records.addlTxt: rcv'd from Atty. Hilary Edwards  kmk

Message received from Stacy at the Jail that because Deft is currently serving a prison sentence he can not begin his conditional jail "comm forthwith" as criminal clerk indicated on the JOC; corrected JOC to be done to remove that wording.  kmk
Cts.1&2 - Dismissed  kmk
Presentence incarceration credit.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Edwards. Clerk/H. Barnett. Court imposes and stays a total sentence of 4 years WSP consecutive to Milwaukee County case 08CF5569:  2 years initial confinement (no credit); 2 years extended supervision; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; deft is placed on probation for 4 years w/conditions, consecutive to Milwauee County case 08CF5569; 1 year conditional jail, agent may stay any balance of conditional jail upon placement in a treatment program they feel is appropriate; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge. No contact with drug users or dealers.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 1 & 2 are dismissed and the repeater enhancer in ct 3 is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  SEH 9/22/17 at 10am.  Bond continued.  Jury is excused at 9:45am.
Juror selection and peremptory challenges.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek and Attorney Thaddeus McGuire appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Ludwig hearing held.  Motions in limine addressed.  Atty Edwards motion to amend instruction.  Court denies motion to amend instruction 140 for reasons set forth on the record.  Witnesses are sequestered.  Jury selection and voir dire completed at 11:14am.  Batson motion held.  Jurors excused.  Trial to commence 6/6/17 at 9am.  Bond continued.
State's Amended List of Witnesses and Demand for Discovery - filed by ADA, Jessica Krejcarek  kmk
Deft's proposed modification of jury instruction 140 with legal memorandum; filed by Atty H Edwards.
Deft's discovery response to State's demand for discovery; filed by Atty H Edwards.
Deft's notice of motion and motions in limine; filed by Atty H Edwards.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case set for jury selection.  ADA Krejcarek states the DNA results are back as of last Friday but the analyst is not available for trial this week.  Atty Edwards states the deft is reasserting his speedy trial demand.  Court grants adjournment of JS to 6/5/17 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
Order to compel the deft to submit to DNA testing.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney B Schwarz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case set for jury selection.  State's motion to compel DNA testing; ADA Krejcarek states they are sending in the gun for testing.  Atty Schwarz states the deft will stipulate to submission of DNA for testing; states the deft is serving a sentence in another matter for the next 10 months, believes a signature bond would remedy the speedy trial demand.  JS is adjourned to 3/13/17 at 8:30am.  Court orders deft to submit to DNA testing.  Court amends bond to $5,000 signature bond with conditions *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Weapons.  *No Contact w/ D.W (DOB 12/4/93) or her residence.  *If released from prison notify attorney weekly of current address and phone number.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Attorney H Edwards appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody but not brought over.  Atty Edwards is in trial in Br 1 today.  JSH is adjourned to 1/9/17 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case remains set for trial.  Atty Edwards advises she has another trial in Br 1 also on 11/28/16.  If the Br 1 speedy trial proceeds the court will adjourn this trial.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Edward's suppression motion.  Testimony taken from KSD Deputy Joshua Jacobs, KSD Deputy Kent Waldow.  Court denies motion to suppress for reasons set forth on the record.  JS set for 11/28/16 at 8:30am and JSH 11/10/16 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
With Elizabeth/DDA Graveley and Atty Edwards the MH is reset to 9/8/16 at 10am.
Due to a continued jury trial Motion Hearing to be rescheduled rather then be moved to the afternoon as requested by ADA Graveley.
With Elizabeth/DDA Graveley and Atty Edwards the MH of 6/23/16 at 2:30pm is rescheduled; as one of the State's witnesses will be unavailable; reset to 7/21/16 at 10am.
With Atty Edwards and Elizabeth/DDA Graveley the MH of 4/22/16 at 10:30am is rescheduled, as Atty Edwards is sick; reset to 6/23/16 at 2:30pm.
Per DOC Agt Sarah Leeman the deft is at Dodge Correctional.

Per KSD Sgt Zoerner the deft is not in custody in the Wisconsin Prison system, Racine County nor Milwaukee County, he spoke with P&P out of Milwaukee per the DOC Locator who could not tell him where the deft is and therefore the writ for 4/22/16 at 10:30am can not be executed.
